citation.article-title: Syntrophus aciditrophicus sp. nov., a new anaerobic bacterium that degrades fatty acids and benzoate in syntrophic association with hydrogen-using microorganisms.

p.s: Description of Syntrophus aciditrophicus sp. nov.

Syntrophus aciditrophicus (a.ci.di.tro'phi.cus., acidum L. nom. n., acid; trephein Gr.v. to feed; trophicus L. suffix relating to feeding; aciditrophicus M.L.adj. one that feeds on acids, acid-feeding)
Gram-negative, nonmotile, nonsporeforming, rod-shaped cells with rounded ends, 0.5– 0.7 μm wide and 1.0 x 1.6 μm.
Cells characteristically appear singly or in pairs.
Colonies on crotonate medium are white, entire, lens-shaped, and 1 mm in diameter.
Growth in liquid medium is uniform.
The temperature range is 25–42 °C, with the fastest growth occurring at 35 °C.
Fumarate, iron(III), polysulfide, and oxyanions of nitrogen and sulfur do not support the growth of S. aciditrophicus with benzoate as the electron donor.

The following compounds support growth of S. aciditrophicus in association with a hydrogen/formate-using partner: benzoate, butyrate, hexanoate, heptanoate, octanoate, palmitate, stearate, trans-2-pentenoate, trans-2-hexanoate, trans-3-hexanoate, 2-octenoate, and methyl esters of butyrate and hexanoate.
Crotonate is the only compound that supports growth of S. aciditrophicus in pure culture.

The following compounds do not support growth in the presence or absence of a hydrogen/formate-using partner: acetoin, formate, propionate, halogenated benzoic acids, hydroxylated benzoic acids, phenols, other aromatic compounds, various organic acids, sugars, amino acids, methyl laurate, methyl myristate, methyl stearate, oxalate, 4-pentenoate, and pimelate.

The cellular fatty acids of strain SBT include C18:1 (presumably cis-11; 42.9% of the total fatty acids), C16:0 (27.0%), cis-9 C16:1 (19.2%), 3-OH C16:0 (3.5%), C18:0 (1.8%), C14:0 (1.2%), and cis-9 C18:1 (0.5%).
The G+C content of the DNA is 43.1 ± 0.1 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
Habitat: sewage sludge from a municipal sewage treatment plant in Norman, Oklahoma, USA.
The type strain is SBT, which has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 700169.
